pylabcontrol.tools package¶

Submodules¶

pylabcontrol.tools.export_default module¶

pylabcontrol.tools.export_default.export(target_folder, source_folders=None, class_type='all', raise_errors=False)[source]¶

exports the existing scripts/instruments (future: probes) into folder as .b26 files :param target_folder: target location of created .b26 script files :param source_folder: singel path or list of paths that contains the location of python script files can also be just the name of a module :param class_type: string, one of the 4 following options

-probes (exports probes) –not implemented yet– -scripts (exports scripts) -instruments (exports instruments) -all (exports instruments, scripts and probes)
Parameters:target_folder – target folder whereb .b26 files are created

Returns:

pylabcontrol.tools.export_default.export_default_instruments(target_folder, source_folder=None, raise_errors=False, verbose=True)[source]¶

tries to instantiate all the instruments that are imported in /instruments/__init__.py and saves instruments that could be instantiate into a .b2 file in the folder path :param target_folder: target path for .b26 files

pylabcontrol.tools.export_default.export_default_probes(path, module_name='', raise_errors=False)[source]¶

NOT IMPLEMENTED YET tries to instantiate all the instruments that are imported in /instruments/__init__.py and the probes of each instrument that could be instantiated into a .b26 file in the folder path :param path: target path for .b26 files

pylabcontrol.tools.export_default.export_default_scripts(target_folder, source_folder=None, raise_errors=False, verbose=False)[source]¶

tries to instantiate all the scripts that are imported in /scripts/__init__.py saves each script that could be instantiated into a .b26 file in the folder path :param target_folder: target path for .b26 files :param source_folder: location of python script files

pylabcontrol.tools.export_default.get_classes_in_folder(folder_name, class_type, verbose=False)[source]¶

load all the instruments or script objects that are located in folder_name and return a dictionary with the script class name and path_to_python_file :param folder_name: folder in which to search for class objects / or name of module :type folder_name: string :param class_type: class type for which to look for :type class_type: string or class

Returns:{ ‘class’: class_of_instruments, ‘filepath’: path_to_python_file }
Return type:a dictionary with the class name and path_to_python_file

Returns:{ ‘class’: class_of_instruments, ‘filepath’: path_to_python_file }
